title: Profile Display
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the Profile tab

custom_steps_separated.expected:
Things to be displayed at the top part of profile page:

- Section at the top of the profile tab with a background color that is determined by the favorite team they have selected
- section should contain the logo of their favorite team
- user's nickname
- user's player level and prestige ranking
- user's total XP, XP bar with current progress
- user's level and how far they are from the next level 

![](index.php?/attachments/get/26585)

The following links should be displayed and clickable:

- "Submit Feedback" -> webview to submit feedback (not in App release) https://mlb.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_6r71KJ3tWMK4oIt

- Select Favorite Team - (there is a separate TC for it)

- Notifications toggle - should either turn blue or grey depending on if you are turning them on or off

- Vibrations toggle - should either turn blue or grey depending on if you are turning them on or off
- How To Play - user is ble to see the how to play tutorial

- Account -> user is presented with a webview to log into their mlb account

- "More MLB Apps" - user is brought to MLBs page on the apple app store

- "More BETMGM apps" -> user is brought to the mgmresorts apps on the apple app store http://appstore.com/mgmresorts

- "Privacy Policy" - user is presented with a webview that details MLB’s complete privacy policy


- "Terms of Use" - user is presented with a webview that details MLB’s complete terms and conditions

- "FAQ" (link points to non-existent page for now) - user is presented with a webview of the most frequently asked questions

- Log Out link - should  bring the user back to the initial landing screen where it asks you to sign up or log in

- the Current Version

![](index.php?/attachments/get/26586)

title: MLB Privacy screen
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "MLB Privacy" screen
custom_steps:
When the user enters valid text in the mandatory fields (marked with a red asterisk)
And selects the CAPTCHA checkbox
And clicks "Submit"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a screen that reads:
"One More Step!
Your identity needs to be confirmed"
And additional text: Please check your email..."
And an email graphic displays at the top of the screen (@ envelope)

title: MLB Customer Service
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "FAQ" screen
custom_steps: When the user scrolls to the bottom of the screen
custom_expected:
Then the user can view the ways to reach MLB Customer Support
And the 866-800-1275 (phone number) displays
And the customerservice@website.mlb.com (email address) displays

title: Privacy Confirmation Email
custom_preconds:
Given: Several hours later than the previous test, the user navigates back to their inbox and opens this email:
"Your Do Not Sell Request Has Been Completed
custom_steps: When the user view the email
custom_expected:
Then the user sees "Your Do Not Sell Request Has Been Completed" in the Subject line
And an MLB logo displays
And text reads: "Hello <Mike>,
We have completed your request under the California Consumer Privacy Act not to sell your personal information.
Regards, The MLB Privacy Team"

title: Privacy Email
custom_preconds: Given: User has navigated to their email inbox and locates the "Your Privacy Access Request" email
custom_steps: When the user clicks the green "Confirm Email"
custom_expected:
Then, in a new tab, the user sees a page with a large green circle with a white check mark
And a header, "Your request is confirmed!" message is visible
And text, "We will review your request and contact you shortly" displays
And the bottom of the page shows:
MLB Privacy
1271 Avenue of the Americas
New York, New York 10020
dataprivacy@mlb.com

title: How to play
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "How To Play"
custom_expected:
Then the "How To Play" screen opens
Then tutorial is displayed (refer to https://testrail.testeng.mlbinfra.net/index.php?/cases/view/8615140&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=305886)
And five dots are visible at the bottom indicating the screen is the first in a carousel

custom_steps_separated.expected: User is presented with a webview to log into their mlb account

title: More MLB Apps
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "More MLB Apps"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to a "MLB" App screen with an array of Apps:
**Latest Release** (sub head)
-- MLB Rally with an "Open" button present (Open
because the user is signed up)
**Apps & Games** (sub head)
-- MLB Rally with an "Open" button present
-- Junior Giants with a "Get" button present
-- RBI Baseball 20 with a $3.99 button present
**iMessage** (sub head)
-- MLB 2016 Sticker Pack with a "Get" button present
**Apple Watch** (sub head)
-- MLB with with an "Open" button present (If user has an Apple Watch)
**Apple TV** (sub head)
--MLB with an "Open" button present (If user has Apple TV)

custom_steps_separated.content: When user clicks on More BetMGM Apps in Profile page
custom_steps_separated.expected: It takes user to App Store where MGM apps will be displayed
Takes user to MLB Privacy Policy page (webview)

title: Do Not Sell My Data
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Do Not Sell My Data"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "MLB Privacy" screen
And the screen shows a "Sign In" button
And show a "Proceed as Guest User" link

title: Terms of Use
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Profile" screen
custom_steps: When the user taps "Terms of Use"
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "Terms of Use Agreement" screen on the MLB App
And the screen contains 15 sections
And the bottom of the screen shows the standard MLB App footer

title: Official Rules
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Profile" screen
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to the "MLB Rally Official Rules" screen on the MLB App
And the screen contains 15 sections
And the bottom of the screen shows the standard MLB App footer

title: FAQ
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Your Profile" screen
custom_expected:
Then the user is redirected to "MLB Rally Frequently Asked Questions' screen
And the screen contains 16 Q/A's

title: Log Out
custom_preconds: Given: from any screen, tap the "Profile" button in the bottom navigation
custom_steps: When the user scrolls to the bottom of the screen and taps "Log Out"
custom_expected: Then the user is redirected to the Sign Up/Log In screen

title: Favorite team
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the profile page
custom_expected:
1. User should see all the MLB teams with their respective logos. 
2. Update button is blue and clickable. 
3. When user taps on a team, the square should be outlined blue and the square’s background should be the teams main color. 
4. When user clicks update after changing their favorite team, user should be brought back to the profile screen. And the newly updated team’s logo should now appear above the username. And the background color should now be the updated team’s primary color

title: How To Play Carousel
custom_preconds: Given: User is viewing the "Choose A Game" screen of the carousel
custom_steps: When the user repeatedly swipes left
custom_expected:
Then each of the "How To Play" screens display:
And each shows a header, an animated graphic and text
And second card is "View Your Stack"
And the third is "Make Your Picks"
And the fourth is "Follow the Action"
And the fifth (last screen in the carousel) is "See Your Results"
And the last screen displays a "Got It" button
And the "How To Play" header includes an "X" button to return to the previous screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Log in as user 21+
2. Go to profile -> Account -> log in to MLB.com -> update the user's age to under 21
3 Go back to Rally
4. Log out and back on to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected: MGM logo is not displayed on the Games tab and user's position on the leaderboards doesn't have a dollar sign

custom_steps_separated.content:
5. Go back to user's account and update it back to 21+
6 Go back to Rally
7. Log out and back on to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected: MGM logo is displayed on the Games tab and user's position on the leaderboard has a dollar sign

custom_steps_separated.content:
8. Go back to user's account and update it to 12 y.o
9. Go back to Rally
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User is not able to proceed with the app
